page.title: 14Coastal walk.
page.content: The start of the interesting coastal walk in this area of study is found at Lower Largo where there is a car park known as the Temple. Near here several of the buildings are of importance such as Cardy House, designed by two Italians below which is the Net factory. Along the sandy shore there are seaweed covered rocks exposed at low tide.The sea wall base is of whinstone while the upper part is of red sandstone.The older houses show some fine examples of of local vernacular architecture.Near to this part of the coast is the statue of "Robinson Crusoe".These stories were based on a native of Largo called Alexander Selkirk. Along the coastline above the high tide zone there is marram grass grown to control moving dunes.
